Description:
SummaryThe Quality Manager plays a pivotal role in ensuring that the ENOWA power generation projects, which span solar, wind, geothermal, thermal (grid-connected), and off-grid power generation, meet the highest quality standards throughout their lifecycle. This individual champions quality assurance, control, and continuous improvement activities during the design, construction, and operational phases, ensuring the project's longevity, safety, and performance.Key Accountabilities and ResponsibilitiesEngineering Management       Develop and implement a comprehensive Quality Management System (QMS) tailored to the project's needs.
Set clear quality objectives, benchmarks, and KPIs in alignment with the project's goals.
Collaborate with design and construction teams to ensure quality considerations are integrated from the onset.
Review designs, materials, and construction methods for quality compliance and sustainability.
Schedule and conduct periodic quality audits throughout the project's lifecycle, identifying areas of improvement and ensuring compliance with industry standards.
Engage third-party auditors when necessary for independent evaluations.
Drive continuous improvement initiatives based on audit findings, feedback, and technological advancements.
Develop and implement corrective and preventive action plans to address identified quality issues.
Facilitate quality training programs for project teams, fostering a culture of quality awareness and continuous improvement.
Stay updated on industry best practices and advancements, disseminating relevant knowledge to the team.
Ensure comprehensive documentation of all quality-related activities, from audit findings to improvement actions.
Regularly report to senior management on quality performance, challenges, and improvement areas.
Collaborate with suppliers, contractors, and other external stakeholders to ensure they adhere to the project's quality standards.
Act as the main point of contact for quality-related inquiries from regulatory bodies and stakeholders.
Provide regular quality performance updates to senior management and other relevant parties.Background, SkillsIn-depth understanding of quality assurance and control principles related to thermal and renewable power generation technologies.
Proven experience in overseeing large-scale power generation projects from design to operation from a quality management perspective.
Demonstrated experience in developing and implementing quality management systems.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
A track record of successful collaboration with multidisciplinary teams.
Knowledge of local, national, and international quality standards and regulations in power generation.
Outstanding problem-solving skills, with the ability to identify, analyze, and resolve technical challenges.
Highly effective communication skills to liaise with internal teams, external partners, and regulatory authorities.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong leadership skills and ability to work independently and in a team.
Travels to project sites as needed.QualificationsBachelor's degree in Engineering, Quality Management, or a related field; a Masterâ€™s degree would be advantageous.
Minimum of 10 years of experience in quality management within the power generation sector, with exposure to both thermal and renewable technologies.
Relevant professional certifications, such as Certified Quality Manager (CQM), Certified Quality Auditor (CQA), or equivalent.
Professional certifications (e.g., PMP, PE, CEng) or equivalent would be beneficial.Job Details
